physical_appearance: This is a beige kebaya top. It has elongated tapered ends, and is embroided with peony and foliage motifs concentrated towards the bottom. The ends of the sleeves are also embroided with peony and foliage motifs.
sgcool_label_text: This kebaya is embroidered with peony and foliage motifs against a gingham fabric with white flecks. Kebayas with elongated tapered ends were popular in the 1930s and many were commissioned by Peranakan women. It is part of a donation which contains a mixture of garments worn by Peranakan men and women.
subject_terms_1: folk costume flowers (motifs) foliage (motif) Peranakan tops (garments, general) blouses (main garments)
subject_terms_2: Ethnic costume Motifs Peranakan (Asian people) Blouses
